title: 5 Steps to Open YouTube Links in Android App

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. Itâ€™s the gear icon in the app drawer. Alternatively, tap the gear icon in the Quick Settings panel (access it by swiping down from the top of your screen).

steps.title: Tap Apps.
steps.content: Tap Apps . Depending on your phone or tablet's manufacturer, this might say "Apps & notifications" instead. Scroll down to see this menu option next to a 2x2, 3x3, or 4x4 grid icon.

steps.title: Tap YouTube.
steps.content: Tap YouTube . The list is displayed alphabetically by default, so "YouTube" will be at the bottom of the menu. You can tap the search bar and search for the app instead.

steps.title: Tap Set as default.
steps.content: Tap Set as default . This is under the "Defaults" header.

steps.title: Tap the switch next to "Open supported links" to turn it on .
steps.content: Tap the switch next to "Open supported links" to turn it on . Tap "Supported web addresses" to see which websites (m.youtube.com, youtube.com, www.youtube.com, and youtu.be) will open inside the app instead of a browser. By default, this setting is on.
